intro: Mitrastylus, commonly known as the white box or yellow box, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their small, narrow leaves and showy white or yellow flowers. Mitrastylus species are often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. They play an important role in the ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various wildlife. The genus includes several species, some of which are threatened due to habitat loss and land clearing.
